creator: dev@21solutions.net
text:
I'm using a URL as follows:

http://mysite.com/index.cfm/value1/value2

if I navigate directly to Tomcat, e.g.

http://mysite.com:8080/index.cfm/value1/value2

I get the correct CGI.SCRIPT_NAME and CGI.PATH_INFO, but if I go via IIS7 then CGI.PATH_INFO is an empty string

creator: mturk@apache.org
text:
Can you give us the debug level log line for the request.
You should have something like:
Reading extension header TOMCATURIXXXXXX: xxxx

for that particular request.

creator: mturk@apache.org
text: Closing because of inactivity, so presume the latest version fixes the issue.
